body: I am using the PHP version of the API, please tell me how to receive incoming message and store them into database. The syntax would help

comment_data.body:
Yes, a code-snippet to read all incoming messages would be really nice :)
It isn't very easy to parse it from all that many messages, which the API transfers :)

There is already the code implemented in the Whatapi.php...

The problem is more related to the fact that you cannot have multiple listeners at the same time...

Which basically means that you should disable the phone client to listen to the messages.

But this is just my experience.

Btw, is whatsapp effectively polling for messages and not working on push?
Can u please help with the code? I used PollMessages() and then GetMessages() but it didn't work, even if the device is switched off. What do u mean by "disable", switching off is not working
thank you very much

hi leader80, let say if u use a php normal web script to run the while loop, it would be forever listening right? my set time limit is 30 second, so I would be always time out ? anyway I can improve to read the message that could be efficient to be run on a web script ?

:-1: 

This is also not working -

GetMessage($mynumber, $from, $id, $type, $time, $name, $body)
Did you create the GetMessage function in your code or did you simply assume that it was there?

Hi,

It is in your documentation 
https://github.com/shirioko/WhatsAPI/wiki/WhatsApi-events

But i also tried this -
$w->Message($userPhone, $body);

<?php
require_once('whatsprot.class.php');
 
$userPhone        = '918*********'; 


$userIdentity     = '35:89***********';

$userName = 'momttty';

$destinationPhone ='15**********';

$password         = 'tFm*************W1EklM='; 

$debug = TRUE;

function onMessage($mynumber, $from, $id, $type, $time, $name, $body)
{
    echo "Message from $name:\n$body\n\n";
}
$w = new WhatsProt($userPhone, $userIdentity, $userName, false);
$w->eventManager()->bind("onGetMessage", "onMessage");
$w->Connect();
$w->LoginWithPassword($password);
$w->PollMessages();

Whats wrong is here ......... I am getting blank page... No array... nthing.


:-1:

Opening an old post here, I still think I have a valid question/contribution to the code of shirioko:

If you poll for messages 10 times and messages are only delivered once in WhatsApp, won't you get nothing because you are overwriting the other 9 times?

post the answer here or mail me :smile: at: Roy@appelneger.nl

Messages are automatically acked by the API when they are received, which deletes them from the server.
And polling 10 times means reading, processing and flushing the buffer 10 times, so it's not like you will still find data from the first poll during the 7th poll.

So if I want to echo the name I have to use the onMessage event and create a function to execute when the event is triggered? 

My next question is: When will the onMessage event be triggered? 
My goal is to execute once in 5 minutes a code that triggers the onMessage event and store all the message data in a database.

That is NOT how events work :')
For your solution you don't use the event manager. Just login, poll and use getMessages() once every 5 minutes to get all new messages.

Sorry for making you cry :sob: , I was thinking about interrupts in C as event. Thank you for your swift respond. excuses for my ignorance. 
After I use getMessages, how do I isolate the variables i want to use? With a foreach loop?
@saurabhnagar Here --> https://github.com/mgp25/WhatsAPI-Official

why you give me this link. I have already this link.This code(which i paste) related to this api but This code show whatsapp message which receive instant but some time after approx 1 minute it not show any message. so please tell me is this possible that i got all incoming message of any number on any time. for example after 1 hour.

Hello,
Hope you are well,

Ok thanks for your help on this issue. i face one more problem
i am working on whatsapp api and when i register any number through api and
watch me android phone then i unregister my whatsapp account. then i
register my account via phone and i use api then i need register again in
api.
for get the password.

So i want that if some one register already on mobile then i get password
directly via api and not register in api. and if i register via api then i
not register in phone again.

Thanks

title: How to receive incoming message?
